1 using FullInspector.Internal;
2 using ProtoBuf;
3 using ProtoBuf.Meta;
4 using System;
5 using System.Collections.Generic;
6 using System.Linq;

8 namespace FullInspector.Serializers.ProtoBufNet {
12  public static class TypeModelCreator {
13  private struct NonGenericSurrogate {
17  public Type ModeledType;
18 
22  public Type SurrogateType;
23  }
24 
28  private static IEnumerable<NonGenericSurrogate> GetNonGenericSurrogates() {
29  return from assembly in RuntimeReflectionUtilities.GetRuntimeAssemblies()
30  from surrogateType in assembly.GetTypes()
31 
32  let surrogateAttribute = surrogateType.GetAttribute<ProtoSurrogateAttribute>()
33  where surrogateAttribute != null
34 
35  where surrogateAttribute.SurrogateFor.IsGenericTypeDefinition == false
36 
37  select new NonGenericSurrogate() {
38  ModeledType = surrogateAttribute.SurrogateFor,
39  SurrogateType = surrogateType
40  };
41  }
42 
43  private struct GenericSurrogate {
47  public Type GenericModeledType;
48 
52  public Type GenericSurrogateType;
53 
57  public IEnumerable<Type[]> TypeArguments;
58  }
59 
63  private static IEnumerable<Type> GetContracts() {
64  return from assembly in RuntimeReflectionUtilities.GetRuntimeAssemblies()
65  from contractType in assembly.GetTypes()
66 
67  where contractType.GetAttribute<ProtoContractAttribute>() != null
68  where contractType.GetAttribute<ProtoSurrogateAttribute>() == null
69 
70  // generic contract types are useless by themselves; they are only used when
71  // requested by some other type that is being serialized, which in that case they
72  // will be instantiated with generic type parameters
73  where contractType.IsGenericTypeDefinition == false
74 
75  select contractType;
76  }
77 
78  private static Type RunSanityCheck(Type type) {
79  if ((type.IsPublic || type.IsNestedPublic) == false) {
80  Throw("sanity check -- type is not public for type={0}", type);
81  }
82 
83  if (type.IsGenericTypeDefinition) {
84  Throw("sanity check -- type is a generic definition for type={0}", type);
85  }
86 
87  return type;
88  }
89 
90  public static RuntimeTypeModel CreateModel() {
91  var model = TypeModel.Create();
92 
93  //--
94  // We want protobuf-net to serialize default values. Sometimes, protobuf-net will skip
95  // serialization when it really shouldn't.
96  //
97  // An example is a nullable struct; the nullable struct can contain a value, but if
98  // that value is the default one then protobuf-net will skip serialization, resulting
99  // in a null nullable type after deserialization.
100  model.UseImplicitZeroDefaults = false;
101 
102  // custom model workers
103  foreach (IProtoModelWorker worker in
104  RuntimeReflectionUtilities.GetAssemblyInstances<IProtoModelWorker>()) {
105 
106  worker.Work(model);
107  }
108 
109  // non-generic surrogates
110  foreach (NonGenericSurrogate surrogate in GetNonGenericSurrogates()) {
111  Type surrogateType = surrogate.SurrogateType;
112 
113  // the surrogate needs to public
114  if (surrogateType.IsVisible == false) {
115  Throw("A surrogate needs to have public visibility for surrogate={0}",
116  surrogateType);
117  }
118 
119  // the surrogate cannot be a generic type
120  if (surrogateType.IsGenericTypeDefinition) {
121  Throw("A generic surrogate also needs to have a [ProtoGenericInstantiator] " +
122  "attribute for surrogate={0}", surrogateType);
123  }
124 
125  // the surrogate needs a [ProtoContract] attribute
126  if (surrogateType.GetAttribute<ProtoContractAttribute>() == null) {
127  Throw("A surrogate is missing a [ProtoContract] attribute for surrogate={0}",
128  surrogateType);
129  }
130 
131  // register the surrogate
132  model.Add(RunSanityCheck(surrogate.ModeledType), false)
133  .SetSurrogate(RunSanityCheck(surrogateType));
134  }
135 
136  // regular old [ProtoContract] types
137  foreach (Type contract in GetContracts()) {
138  if (contract.IsVisible == false) {
139  Throw("A ProtoContract type needs to have public visibility for contract={0}",
140  contract);
141  }
142 
143  model.Add(RunSanityCheck(contract), true);
144  }
145 
146  // Fields and properties on UnityObject derived types, such as BaseBehavior, are not
147  // annotated with serialization annotations. This means that for protobuf-net, if a
148  // BaseBehavior contains a Dictionary{string,string} field, then that specific generic
149  // instantiation may not be discovered, as the field does not serve as an anchor.
150  //
151  // In this loop, we go through all UnityObject derived types and ensure that every
152  // serialized property is in the RuntimeTypeModel.
153  foreach (var behaviorType in RuntimeReflectionUtilities.GetUnityObjectTypes()) {
154  // We only want UnityObject types are serializable by ProtoBufNet
155  // TODO: support custom base classes
156  if (typeof(BaseBehavior<ProtoBufNetSerializer>).IsAssignableFrom(behaviorType) == false) {
157  continue;
158  }
159 
160  var serializedProperties = InspectedType.Get(behaviorType).SerializedProperties;
161  foreach (InspectedProperty property in serializedProperties) {
162  // If the property is generic and the model currently doesn't contain it, make
163  // sure we add it to the model.
164  if (property.StorageType.IsGenericType &&
165  ContainsType(model, property.StorageType) == false) {
166 
167  model.Add(property.StorageType, true);
168  }
169  }
170  }
171 
172  return model;
173  }
174 
178  private static bool ContainsType(RuntimeTypeModel model, Type type) {
179  foreach (MetaType metaType in model.GetTypes()) {
180  if (metaType.Type == type) {
181  return true;
182  }
183  }
184 
185  return false;
186  }
187 
193  private static void Throw(string format, params object[] parameters) {
194  throw new InvalidOperationException(string.Format(format, parameters));
195  }
196 
197  }
198 }
FullInspector.Internal.RuntimeReflectionUtilities.GetUnityObjectTypes
static IEnumerable< Type > GetUnityObjectTypes()
Returns all types that derive from UnityEngine.Object that are usable during runtime.

FullInspector.Internal.InspectedProperty
A PropertyMetadata describes a discovered property or field in a TypeMetadata.

FullInspector.Internal.InspectedProperty.StorageType
Type StorageType
The type of value that is stored inside of the property. For example, for an int field, StorageType will be typeof(int).
Definition: InspectedProperty.cs:125
